I question the value of this change after netty/netty#10330 is available. The only benefit I see is that the name of the exception is different in the logs. As the class is private, users can not use the exception to decide further actions. Is that what your intent is?
If we create a publicly accessible exception class like TooLongHttpPayloadException then the change makes more sense to me.

The confusion was that IllegalArgumentException is thrown when users don't pass any argument. A more clear instance of IllegalStateException makes more sense in this case.
I'm ok with making the exception type public.
